fields.description:
!image.png!

*Cause:*
An epic link field in the Edit Screen is causing the popup message to appear even though there is no change made. There's an error message in the screen stated that {color:red}A subtask cannot be assigned to an epic{color}.

*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Create a new "Agile" project
# Create an issue for the project.
# Create a sub task for the issue of the project
# Press "E" or click on Edit
# Click on Cancel. Popup message stated that "You have entered new data on this page. If you navigate away from this page without first saving your data, the changes will be lost." is displayed.

*Expected:* No popup appear if there is no change made
*Actual Result:* Popup message stated that "You have entered new data on this page. If you navigate away from this page without first saving your data, the changes will be lost." is displayed.

*Notes*
There's an error message in the screen stated that {color:red}A subtask cannot be assigned to an epic{color}. 

*Workaround:*
# Create a new screen for sub-task. You could just simply copy the screen from the original agile screen and make sure you remove the epic link field from the newly created screen.
# Create a new screen scheme and configure the scheme so that the scheme is using the screen that you've just created for the sub-task.
# Go back to the Agile project and associate the screen scheme to issue type sub-task.
fields.summary: Edit Sub-task issue of an Agile Project always detect changes even though no change is made

fields.description:
When having a large backlog, dragging issues up and down to sort the backlog is not something that is doable. Therefore the backlog order will be more or less random. One solution could have been to set the ORDER BY ... in the boards filter to priority, fixversion or something else other than Rank, but then it is not possible to create sprints!

The above is a really serious limitation of JIRA Agile. Even if there are technical challenges in solving this request, it is very important to make JIRA Agile usable for anything but small projects.
fields.summary: Allow the creation of a sprint when the backlog is sorted by something else than rank

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently in JIRA Software it's possible to have multiple Epics with the same Epic Name. This is causing a number of confusions as follows:
h3. #1 - Not possible to tell which Story belongs to which Epic from Backlog, Active Sprint, and Issue Navigator

If 2 Epics on the same board (they may belong to 2 different projects) have the same Epic Name and Color, and each has a few Stories, it's impossible to tell which Story belongs to which Epic. This applies to Backlog, Active Sprint, and Issue Navigator.
h4. +Workarounds for #1+
 # If possible, change the Epic Name of 1 of the Epics
 # If Epic Name can't be changed for any reason, change the Color of 1 of the Epics - this can be done from Backlog and it will look like this afterwards:
 !backlog.png|thumbnail!

h4. +Suggested Solutions for #1+
 # Prevent Epics from having the same name - as per JSWSERVER-16366
 # Pre-pend the issue key of an Epic to its name for labeling purpose, e.g.:
 ** EPIC-1 - Same Epic Name
 ** EPIC-2 - Same Epic Name

----
h3. #2 - Exporting issues to HTML (or Excel) and CSV

Take a look at this search result:
 !search.png|thumbnail!

If we export that search result to HTML (or Excel, as HTML can be opened by Excel and saved as XLSX), the exported data will look like this:

!html.png|thumbnail!

(i) Notice that Epic Names are exported under Epic Link column

(flag) Apparently it's impossible to tell which Story belongs to which Epic
----
If we export that search result to CSV instead, the exported data will look like this:

!csv.png|thumbnail!

(i) Notice that issue keys of the Epics are exported under Epic Link column

(+) Users may base on the issue keys to find the right Epics (take note that Epics and Stories must be exported together)
h4. +Workarounds for #2+
 # If possible/applicable, change the Epic Name of 1 of the Epics
 # If you're using HTML export and expect issue key to be exported instead of Epic Name, switch to CSV export - this is for JRASERVER-62296
 # If you're using CSV export and expect Epic Name to be exported instead of issue key, switch to HTML export - this is for JRASERVER-67146

h4. +Suggested Solutions for #2+

If we can pre-pend the issue key of an Epic to its name for labeling purpose, e.g. *{{KEY-123 - Epic Name}}*, then use this value for Epic Link field and consistently export it regardless of HTML/CSV exports.
----
h3. Notes

As per JSWSERVER-14746, users may expect that an issue should have both Epic Name and Epic Link for a search result similar to [^search.png], so that when issues are exported, they can see the Epic Name under Epic Name column and issue key of the Epic under Epic Link column. This is a misconception and can't be achieved because:
 * Epic Name is specific to Epic issue type
 * Epic Link is used by other issue types to link to an Epic issue type

So basically:
 * An Epic has Epic Name but no Epic Link
 * Other issue types can have an Epic Link but can never have an Epic Name

(+) Refer to *#2* above for a possible workaround.
fields.summary: Better handle Epic Name, Epic Link, and issue exports to HTML/CSV

fields.description:
h3. Summary
While doing ranking operation Issue ranking request has two limits
* Total time limit for retry for whole method: 4000 ms
* More specific timeout for rank lock: 1500 ms
In some cases (see below) issue ranking operation fails to save new rank due to rank lock expire.  This is caused by doing number of SQL calls to {{AO_60DB71_LEXORANK}} table under lock and some of them are slow (see below). 

At this stage, we believe this *is not a JIRA bug*. That being said, we will keep ticket open for some time to monitor the problem. 

h3. Environment
* Large JIRA instance: 1M+ issue 
** Basically we need large  {{AO_60DB71_LEXORANK}} table
* MySQL 5.6.x
** We identified problem for MySQL (5.6.x only), other DBs might be also affected, needs more checking 
* JIRA 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Try to rank issue at the bottom of the RANK 
#* Currently problem is easily reproducible for EPIC ranking, since they are mostly at the bottom 

h3. Expected Results
Rank operation is successful. 

h3. Actual Results
* EPIC ranking operation fails and that give *error in UI*:
_JIRA Software cannot execute the rank operation at this time. Other users may be ranking the issues that you are trying to rank. Please try again later_
** Rest call: /rest/agile/1.0/epic/<Epic_ID>/rank returns 500 
 
h3. Notes
* Detailed debug logging shows that EPIC rank fails to store new rank in DB due to *lock timeout*. 
** To enable logging set _DEBUG_ for {{com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.lexorank}} and {{com.atlassian.greenhopper.manager.lexorank}}
** Logs
{noformat}
2017-05-15 03:51:37,226 https-8443-exec-12 DEBUG admin 231x1024011x9 2h8zm5 1.1.1.1 /rest/agile/1.0/epic/1582851/rank [greenhopper.manager.lexorank.LexoRankDaoImpl]  LexoRank Query : SELECT FIELD_ID,ID,ISSUE_ID,LOCK_HASH,LOCK_TIME,RANK,TYPE FROM AO_60DB71_LEXORANK WHERE FIELD_ID = ? AND RANK <= ? ORDER BY RANK DESC LIMIT 2; params[15180, 0|i18v13:]
2017-05-15 03:51:42,614 https-8443-exec-12 DEBUG admin 231x1024011x9 2h8zm5 1.1.1.1 /rest/agile/1.0/epic/1582851/rank [greenhopper.manager.lexorank.LexoRankDaoImpl]  LexoRank Query : SELECT FIELD_ID,ID,ISSUE_ID,LOCK_HASH,LOCK_TIME,RANK,TYPE FROM AO_60DB71_LEXORANK WHERE FIELD_ID = ? AND RANK >= ? ORDER BY RANK ASC LIMIT 2; params[15180, 0|i18v1b:] 
2017-05-15 03:51:42,617 https-8443-exec-12 DEBUG admin 231x1024011x9 2h8zm5 1.1.1.1 /rest/agile/1.0/epic/1582851/rank [greenhopper.service.lexorank.LexoRankOperation] Save of rank row [LexoRankRow{id=3101388, fieldId=15180, issueId=1582851, lockHash='8284c06d-a7bf-4da9-ae34-77fe6685e51a', lockTime=1494845497223, bucket=0, rank='0|i18v17:', type=ISSUE_RANK_ROW}] failed, retrying rank operation
{noformat}
* slow SQL (*3.47 sec*)
{code:borderStyle=solid}
mysql>SELECT FIELD_ID,ID,ISSUE_ID,LOCK_HASH,LOCK_TIME,RANK,TYPE FROM AO_60DB71_LEXORANK WHERE FIELD_ID = 15180 AND RANK <= '0|i18v53:' ORDER BY RANK DESC LIMIT 2; 
{code}
* Note that not all calls are slow, response time depends on actual RANK value (position in the table). 

To help investigate problem like this in the future, please see KB based on this bug:
* [Issue ranking operation fails - JIRA Software cannot execute the rank operation at this time|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Issue+ranking+operation+fails+-+JIRA+Software+cannot+execute+the+rank+operation+at+this+time]

h5. MySQL notes 
After some additional deep research from our side, we found a MySQL bug with very similar description which was fixed in 5.7:
* https://bugs.mysql.com/bug.php?id=61631
** fixed in 5.7
* Quote from https://dev.mysql.com/doc/relnotes/mysql/5.7/en/news-5-7-0.html
bq. For the index merge access method, the optimizer could make a suboptimal choice of indexes to use. (Bug #14095506)

h3.Workaround
* In case of MySQL, please upgrade to MySQL *5.7*. We have a confirmation from the client that fixes the problem. 
* In case of MSSQL, problem was caused by wrong column type: RANK was varchar, it should be *nvarchar*.

h3. Note on fix
Since not all clients will be able quickly upgrade to MySQL 5.7, we decided to implement workaround for the problem in JIRA itself. In corresponding fixed version, code was changes to avoid SQL "RANK <= 'abc' ORDER BY RANK DESC"
fields.summary: Issue ranking operation fails to save new rank due to slow DB operation in MySQL and MS-SQL

h3. Problem Definition

As mentioned in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-13625, the "Create Linked Issue" does not have an option not to copy Agile data. Beside the option not to copy all the Agile data, the user would also like an option to choose which field values that they can copy. For example, the user would like the option to choose which Sprint values that the new issue should contain. This is important since creating a new issue which is associated to completed Sprint is cause inconsistency in the report.


h3. Suggested Solution

Add option during issue creation using "Create Linked Issue" so the user can choose which field values that should be retained.


h3. Workaround 

Create issue manually and link the issue

h4. Problem
When the project side-bar is collapsed, when you click the ... in the top left corner to see all the boards, there is no scrollbar here.
* If you expand the project side-bar, the scrollbar is available

h5. Steps to Reproduce
* Create boards for a single project until the list is too long to be listed in a single view (I was able to reproduce this with about 20 boards in a single project)

* Navigate to the project page, ensure that the side-bar is collapsed
* Hover over the "..." to list all boards
** Note that there is no scroll-bar available

Expand the project side-bar before checking the boards list.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
On KanPlan, transitioning more than one issues to Column with multiple Statuses do not prompt user to choose the Status. This happen when one of the Status in the Column has a Transition screen.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.4 EAP01
* KanPlan - Kanban with Backlog enabled

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup KanPlan
# Configure the second Column to have two Statuses
# Set the first "Status 1" without Transition screen
# Set the second "Status 2" *with* Transition screen
# In Backlog, transition two issues to the second Column
# KanPlan automatically chooses "Status 1" without any acknowledgment to the user.

h3. Suggested Solution
UI to prompt the user to choose which Status to transition to and share warning when "Status 2" is chosen.

h3. Why this is important
Informing the user that the status it transition to _may not_ be the transition user expected it to go to.
fields.summary: KanPlan - Transition multiple issues to Column with multiple Statuses do not prompt to choose

fields.description:
It would be nice to have the ability to reopen an empty sprint just in case issues were removed from the sprint and the sprint was complete with no issues inside of the sprint.

If you try to reopen an empty sprint right now, you will be met with the following in the JIRA UI:

!Screenshot for JIRA support.png|thumbnail!

Currently, you can bulk update a single story into the sprint --> reopen it but this can be time consuming and reopening the sprint in the database is not recommended. Being able to just use the reopen button here would be a nice enhancement.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
If you have a sprint that is started with zero issues and\or story points and then add some later, the sprint health gadget still shows 0% scope change.

As per -JSWSERVER-10665-, this is because the logic does not expect a sprint to be started with zero issues in it, and I would agree that this is bad practice. However, the fact remains that this situation does represent a scope change and so the gadget is misleading when it says that there is zero scope change because you can't divide by zero.

At the bottom of that issue it is also stated that this will not be fixed because of it's edge nature, but I would argue that even showing "Error: Original Estimate Equal to Zero" would be preferable to something misleading.
fields.summary: Improve Sprint Health Scope Change When Initial Scope is Zero

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, there is no documentation on how does JIRA Software reports are being generated from backend or what are the conditions that have to be met for issues to be included in the reports.
h3. Suggested Solution

Have a section in [JIRA Software Reporting|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASOFTWARESERVER073/Reporting] explaining on how does the Reports are being generated.
h3. Notes

For example, Release Burndown report is being generated:
 # Take all issues which are displayed on the board and gather all sprints from them.
 # Take all sprints which belong to this board.
 # Let's union these two sets.

This is how all the Sprints are being gathered in this report at the backend.
fields.summary: Documentation update on JIRA Software reporting

fields.description:
h5. Summary

When we start a sprint with stories containing sub-tasks, the sprint field value of the sub-task is empty. As a result, if a sub-task is converted to a story, it move out of the sprint, because the sprint value is empty.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Start a sprint with issue containing sub-tasks.
2. Convert a sub-task to an issue.

 
h5. Environment

JIRA 7.0.0, JIRA 7.3.6

 
h5. Expected Result


The converted sub-task stays in the sprint

 
h5. Actual Result


The converted sub-task moves out of the sprint.

 
h5. Workaround

 

Manually add the task to the Sprint. 

* FYI, for active sprint, it'll trigger scope change.
fields.summary: Sprint field for a sub-task does not hold the value of the sprint it is part of

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When you go to the Board Configuration, in the *Issue Detail View*, you see two Priority fields if the field is not configured.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a board and go to Configure, then Issue Detail View
# If the Priority field is already in the *General Fields*, delete it.
# Try to add the Priority again and you will see:
!Screen Shot 2017-05-04 at 11.15.20.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

Only one Priority field is displayed

h3. Actual Results

Duplicate fields are shown 

h3. Notes

It seems that there is not a difference in the application whether you choose the first or the second, but it can still cause confusion.
fields.summary: Duplicated Priority Field in Issue Detail View

permission to users who have access to the Sprint.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The standalone downloads from [the JIRA software website|https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/download] for versions 7.3.5 and 7.3.6 are gzipped twice.

The Mac version of tar will handle this without issue and a {{tar -zxf}} will work as expected. However, on linux tar will fail to unzip and untar the download.
h3. Environment
 * CentOS 7 (all linux versions most likely)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Download standalone JIRA Software tar.gz
 # Attempt to extract using {{tar -zxf}}

h3. Expected Results

File is extracted to directory
h3. Actual Results
{noformat}
[atlassian@cent-nat ~]$ tar -zxf atlassian-jira-software-7.3.5.tar.gz 
tar: This does not look like a tar archive
tar: Skipping to next header
tar: Exiting with failure status due to previous errors
[atlassian@cent-nat ~]$ 
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Use gunzip and then rename to get tar working:
{code:java}
[atlassian@cent-nat ~]$ gunzip atlassian-jira-software-7.3.6.tar.gz
[atlassian@cent-nat ~]$ mv atlassian-jira-software-7.3.6.tar atlassian-jira-software-7.3.6.tar.gz
[atlassian@cent-nat ~]$ tar -zxf atlassian-jira-software-7.3.6.tar.gz  
{code}
fields.summary: Standalone tar.gz downloads are gzipped twice and fail to uncompress with tar on linux

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Lexorank operation can fail for 10 minutes and cause communication breakdown when creating multiple subtasks on transition with 3rd party plugins


h3. Environment
* Instance is setup to use the BobSwift create on transition plugin (I believe scriptrunner could also do this), as well as the JIRA Workflow Toolbox extension in order to be able to create upwards of 20 subtasks when a particular issue is transitioned, based upon the values of custom fields in that issue
* instance has this problem on 7.2.6, 7.2.8, and 7.3.4
* This problem is related to the previous bug of [JSWSERVER-13756|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-13756].   The major difference being that JIRA does not deadlock in this case when this happens now.  However it can still generate an error and appear to temporarily have a problem in regards to the indexes of this parent issue/child issues for a few minutes.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a workflow that will generate 20 different subtasks upon transition that are all children of the same parent issue.
# Create two different parent issues in this project
# Execute this same transition on both issues at nearly the same time

h3. Expected Results
JIRA will create all the subtasks and continue on it's way happily


h3. Actual Results
# JIRA displays a spinning wheel for a several seconds before it throws a communication breakdown error
# Also it appears that the problem is in regards to ranking operations that are failing: {code:borderStyle=solid}
2017-04-18 18:52:09,175 http-nio-4933-exec-24 uri:/secure/WorkflowUIDispatcher.jspa username:administrator DEBUG administrator 1131x1376x1 1xldvnm 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/WorkflowUIDispatcher.jspa [c.a.g.service.lexorank.LexoRankOperation] RANK_INITIAL end   [fieldId=10300, issueToRankIssueId=31332, issueToRankAroundIssueId=null
2017-04-18 18:52:09,175 http-nio-4933-exec-24 uri:/secure/WorkflowUIDispatcher.jspa username:administrator WARN administrator 1131x1376x1 1xldvnm 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/WorkflowUIDispatcher.jspa [c.a.g.customfield.lexorank.LexoRankCFType] Unable to retrieve rank for field [10300] and issue [31332]
2017-04-18 18:52:09,175 http-nio-4933-exec-24 uri:/secure/WorkflowUIDispatcher.jspa username:administrator WARN administrator 1131x1376x1 1xldvnm 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/WorkflowUIDispatcher.jspa [c.a.g.customfield.lexorank.LexoRankCFType] gh.lexorank.service.error.retrytimeout 
{code}
# In this case it took the system almost exactly 10 minutes in order to finally finish the initial ranking option for issue 31332:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
2017-04-18 19:02:18,667 http-nio-4933-exec-24 uri:/secure/WorkflowUIDispatcher.jspa username:administrator DEBUG administrator 1131x1376x1 1xldvnm 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/WorkflowUIDispatcher.jspa [c.a.g.service.lexorank.LexoRankOperation] Ranked issue[id=31332] initially with rank[1|i007wn:] for rank field[id=10300]  
{code}
 
h3. Notes
* JIRA does appear to recover from this problem eventually, unlike the previous [JSWSERVER-13756|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-13756], but it does appear to take several minutes before the system is able to rank all the issues.  In some cases a foreground index might also be required to update the indexes.
* If only transitioning one of these issues, this problem does not appear to happen.  However having more than one JIRA user in the system is expected to happen, so the occurrence of these nearly simultaneous transitions is likely.
* Feels like maybe we are hitting up against a limitation of multiple threads all trying to obtain a lock on the rank field of an issue

h3.Workaround
- Disable Bobswift plugin (which prevents the creation of the subtasks)
- Manually create subtasks
fields.summary: Lexorank operation can fail for 10 minutes and cause communication breakdown when creating multiple subtasks on transition with 3rd party plugins

h3. Summary

Right clicking at backlog when the backlog has large number of Sprints will cause JiRA to hide some of the Sprints in the backlog 
!Backlog Bug.png|thumbnail!

or the pop up windows is shown on the top of the backlog page itself, instead of appearing just beside the cursor/selected issues
!BacklogBugv2.png|thumbnail!

Steps to reproduce:
 # Create multiple Sprints in a Scrum board (around 10)
 # Create about 10 issues in the same board.
 # Scroll down to the issues in the backlog and right click at one of the issue.
 # Some of the earlier Sprint will be hidden or pop up window is shown on the top of backlog page


h3. Environment

JIRA 7.1.4, 7.1.9

 
h3. Expected Results

JIRA shows all the Sprints available when user right clicked beside any issue

 
h3. Actual Results

Some Sprints which were created earlier will be hidden from the option that's shown after user right clicked at issue

 
h3. Workaround

We can try to reduce the number of Sprints in the backlog to ensure that maximum amount of Sprints will be shown from the options.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
If an epic is added to a sprint, through manually adding it with the sprint field, it will not appear in the backlog view.  In addition, when the Sprint is started it will display a warning regarding the Epic as a hidden issue.  The warning message states: “Includes issue(s) currently hidden by a Quick Filter or the Instant Filter” However the Epic is excluded as it is an Epic, not by the Quick or Instant filters.

h3. Suggested Solution
Update the error message - to account for Epics or update the documentation to explain why Epics are not included in the view and would cause this error. 

h3. Workaround 
The Epics have their own section and are not displayed in the Backlog due to their scope. Please see [Working with Epics|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASOFTWARESERVER073/Working+with+epics] for more details. They will however appear in the Active Sprint, if modified to be in the sprint.
fields.summary: Epics not shown in backlog will cause misleading warning message on Sprint start

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, if a sprint contains issues that are in a non-editable status, clicking 'complete a sprint' will close the sprint with misleading/confusing errors and behaviors. 

Closing a sprint with an issue in non-editable status causes the following behavior: 

* An error is thrown: 
{noformat}This issue cannot be edited because of its workflow status'. 0 issues were done
1 issue was incomplete. Select where all incomplete items should be moved:{noformat}
* Complete button is still available 
* Clicking the Complete button leads to another error and the Complete button is still available:  
{noformat}
Error
Cannot update closed sprint
{noformat}
* Cancel link has to be clicked to close the window. 
* Non-editable items are not moved to the next sprint but are returned to the backlog. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Do not allow sprints containing non-editable issues to be closed or present a clearer message like: 

{quote}
The error message displayed when the user closes the sprint is misleading. User doesn't know if the issue is moved to the next sprint or the backlog. The error message should display something similar like "the issue can't be moved to the selected Sprint because it is in non-editable status. Do you want to continue to move it to backlog".
{quote}

h3. Why this is important

The error message displayed when the user closes the sprint is misleading. User doesn't know if the issue is moved to the next sprint or the backlog. 
 
h3. Workaround 

Reject issues that are sent back to the backlog and move them into the next sprint.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to prevent sprints with issues in non-editable statuses to be closed

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Issue creators are able to attach files of any type to an issue, which can complicate things for issue screeners/processors in that they might not have the correct software to read them or will lose valuable time in manually downloading attachments for external viewing. Additionally, administrators may want to restrict certain file types (e.g., executables) for security reasons.
h3. Suggested Solution

Implement a file type filter on a global or project level to restrict attachments to only desired file types.
h3. Why this is important

Issue screeners may not have the software necessary to view attached files, which can cause delays in ticket processing. Additionally, some file types must be downloaded to view, which can also contribute to delay. On the security front, attached executables may lead to security issues when downloaded and run.
h3. Workaround

There are third-party add-ons that accomplish this task (e.g., [Attachment Checker|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.akelesconsulting.jira.plugins.AttachmentChecker/server/overview.]).
fields.summary: As an administrator I want to restrict file types for issue attachments in JIRA

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After changing the *username* of an user on *node1*, sometimes this user will not be able to log in any other nodes aside from *node1*.
Tech details: _ApplicationUserEntity_ used in {{UserKeyStoreImpl}}'s caches' keys is not Serializable and causes java.io.NotSerializableException in Data Center.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Data Center

h3. Steps to Reproduce
For end user:
# After changing the *username* of an user on *node1*, sometimes this user will not be able to log in any other nodes aside from *node1*.
# Deploy a new JIRA Data Center cluster with two nodes
# Create an user (e.g. *user1*) at _node1_
# On _node1_, change *user1*'s username to *user2*.
# Try to login as user *user2* at _node2_.

For developers:
# Deploy a new JIRA Data Center cluster with two nodes, making sure you are not using an *unlimited* license.
# Create an user (e.g. *user1*).
# On *node1*, flush all caches
# On *node1*, change *user1*'s username to *user2*.

h3. Expected Results
Cache is correctly replicated to other nodes in the cluster and *user2* is able to login properly.

h3. Actual Results
The following exception is thrown on *node1*:
{noformat}

    	java.io.NotSerializableException: com.atlassian.jira.user.ApplicationUserEntity. Cache: com.atlassian.jira.user.util.UserKeyStoreImpl.keyToUserCache Peer: com.atlassian.jira.user.util.UserKeyStoreImpl.keyToUserCache
java.rmi.MarshalException: error marshalling arguments; nested exception is: 
	java.io.NotSerializableException: com.atlassian.jira.user.ApplicationUserEntity
	at sun.rmi.server.UnicastRef.invoke(UnicastRef.java:158)
	at net.sf.ehcache.distribution.RMICachePeer_Stub.remove(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.jira.cluster.cache.ehcache.BlockingParallelCacheReplicator.lambda$replicateRemovalNotification$1(BlockingParallelCacheReplicator.java:163)
	at com.atlassian.jira.cluster.cache.ehcache.BlockingParallelCacheReplicator.lambda$null$3(BlockingParallelCacheReplicator.java:203)
	at com.atlassian.jira.cluster.cache.ehcache.ClassLoaderSwitchingRunnable.run(ClassLoaderSwitchingRunnable.java:18)
	at java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture$AsyncRun.run(CompletableFuture.java:1626)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
Caused by: java.io.NotSerializableException: com.atlassian.jira.user.ApplicationUserEntity
	at java.io.ObjectOutputStream.writeObject0(ObjectOutputStream.java:1184)
	at java.io.ObjectOutputStream.defaultWriteFields(ObjectOutputStream.java:1548)
	at java.io.ObjectOutputStream.writeSerialData(ObjectOutputStream.java:1509)
	at java.io.ObjectOutputStream.writeOrdinaryObject(ObjectOutputStream.java:1432)
	at java.io.ObjectOutputStream.writeObject0(ObjectOutputStream.java:1178)
	at sun.rmi.server.UnicastRef.marshalValue(UnicastRef.java:294)
	at sun.rmi.server.UnicastRef.invoke(UnicastRef.java:153)
	... 8 more
{noformat}

This happens because the class {{com.atlassian.jira.user.ApplicationUserEntity}} does not implement the interface {{Serializable}}. Due to that *node1* will fail to replicate this cache invalidation event to other nodes, making them unaware *user1* is now called *user2*.

h3. Notes
The specific operation during normal JIRA usage causing a cache flush is still unknown. There is some suspicion on third-party add-ons calling {{ClearCacheEvent}}, which could cause this.

h3.Workaround
* Perform rolling restarts on all nodes except the one where the user was renamed.
fields.summary: Users that had their usernames renamed after a cache flush event will not be able to log into other nodes

        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)

Any problems are temporary. JIRA Software and bundled plugins will re-enable once UPM update is complete. This may take multiple minutes.

h3. Workaround

Do not update UPM in production JIRA applications outside of planned maintenance windows. As a best practice test updates to plugins, including UPM, in a test or staging environment prior to updating production.
See related [Best Practices for Managing JIRA Application Add-ons|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/best-practices-for-managing-jira-application-add-ons-892612178.html]

h3. Additional details

UPM update has been tested with JIRA Core, JIRA Software and JIRA Service Desk. Required bundled plugins are only disabled when JIRA Software is present. 
* UPM update after installing JIRA Software onto an existing JIRA installation will not result in this problem unless JIRA has been restarted after installing JIRA Software and before updating UPM.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

We want to have the dashboard shown on our wall monitor, however the lack of auto-refresh means that it is out of date very quickly, and thus largely useless.

If the contents of the board are updated, it does put a yellow "click here to refresh the board", but it does not actually refresh the board. Note that this behaviour is independent of the "refresh interval".

the behaviour does not change whether the interval is Never or 15 minutes. The yellow sign turns up soon after the board is out of date, but the board itself *never refreshes*.
 Somehow the javascript knows that there was an update, but the data doesn't come through and doesn't get displayed.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# create a new dashboard on JIRA
# create a new agile project in JIRA
# create some new issues in the project and create a sprint
# create a new project board to display current sprint
# from JIRA dashboards, click add gadget and select Agile Wallboard gadget
# select the agile project board to display from step 4
# select 15 min refresh interval from the list.
# create a new bug in the agile project and add it to the sprint

h3. Expected Results
* The wallboard gadget will refresh after 15 mins and show the updates to from the Agile project sprint.

h3. Actual Results
* The wallboard will send a new request every 30 sec. will show a yellow sticker telling that the board has been updated, refresh or ignor.
 * The wall board data will not auto update.

h3. Notes
* I have tested this with Google Chrome Version 56.0.2924.87 (64-bit)
fields.summary: Dashboard "Agile Wallboard Gadget" is not automatically refreshing

fields.description:
h4. Summary: 

If there is an issue in a non-editable status when a sprint is completed, an error ''This issue cannot be edited because of its workflow status' is thrown and the Complete button is still available. Clicking Complete again will throw another error 'Cannot update closed sprint'. Cancel has to be clicked to close the dialog window and non-editable issues are returned to the backlog.

h4. Steps to Replicate: 

# Create a Scrum project 
# Create a status: 'In Review'
# Make 'In Review' a non-editable status by adding property: jira.issue.editable = false
# Create a new sprint - Sprint One
# Create a new sprint - Sprint Two
# Add an issue to Sprint One and start the Sprint
# Transition the issue to 'In Review' and confirm it is non-editable
# Complete the Sprint
# In the _move to_ drop-down, select Sprint Two
# Click Complete link

h4. Expected Result: 

* The dialog window closes
* All issues move to the next sprint
* Incomplete issues are moved to the backlog.

h4. Actual Result: 

* An error is thrown: 
{noformat}This issue cannot be edited because of its workflow status'. 0 issues were done
1 issue was incomplete. Select where all incomplete items should be moved:{noformat}
* Complete button is still available 
* Clicking the Complete button leads to another error and the Complete button is still available:  
{noformat}
Error
Cannot update closed sprint
{noformat}
* Cancel link has to be clicked to close the window. 
* Non-editable items are not moved to the next sprint but are returned to the backlog. 

Workaround: None. 

h4. Notes
 The error message should display something similar like "the issue can't be moved to the selected Sprint because it is in non-editable status. Do you want to continue to move it to backlog"
fields.summary: 'Complete Sprint' button stays active and a misleading error is thrown when closing a sprint with an issue in an non-editable status

fields.description:
As a Project Administrator, I want to be able to create new components from the Create Issue screen while creating the first issue in the project and before any components have been added to the project.
h3. Problem Definition

Before any components have been added to a project, the Components field displays a value of "None" and is not editable. 
h3. Suggested Solution

The Components field should enable users with the _Administer projects_ permission to create components to do so even if no components exist for the project.
h3. Why this is important

The field behavior on new projects is confusing because it is inconsistent with the behavior of the same field on existing projects. I have to add a component manually in order to enable the field, which slows me down when starting new projects. I want to be able to add components "on the fly" from the very start.
h3. Workaround

Select *Components* in the project sidebar and add one component. After this, the Components field is editable on all issues in the project. Administrators can use this field to create new components and users can use it to select existing components.
fields.summary: Not able to create first component in a project from the Create Issue screen

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary

When a user creates a sub-task in JIRA off an issue from a JIRA Agile project that already has a component field, the newly created sub-task does not inherit the parent issues Component.

h5. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a test component in a project e.g. *Test Comp* that is an Agile project
# Create an issue.
# Add the *Test Comp* component to the issue created above.
# Remove the "Component/s" field from issue create screen
# Create a sub-task; make sure Component/s field is hidden on the issue create dialog

h5. Affects Version

The above issue was observed in *JIRA 7.2.8, JIRA 7.3.x* and we can confirm that it works correctly in *JIRA 6.4.13* (the customer tested this on *JIRA 6.4.8*).

h5. Expected Behavior

The sub-task would inherit the parent issue's component

h5. Actual Behavior

The sub-task component field is empty and you would need to manually set it.

h5. Workaround

# You can manually set this.
# You can use a plugin like Minyaa Suite which has a post function to make the Child issue inherit the parent issue's Component field.
(i) _Please note that we do not provide support if you decide to proceed with the second suggestion._
fields.summary: Sub-Task No Longer Inherits Parent's Component Field

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Broken link for "Learn more about branching strategies" in JIRA issue page
h3. Environment
Customer reported in JIRA 7.1.1, still reproduceable in JIRA 7.3.3
h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Link Bitbucket Cloud account to JIRA instance.
2. Create a new issue, then view issue details.
3. Click on the "Create Branch" link to open the dialog box.
4. Click on the "Learn more about branching" link.
h3. 
Expected Results
A new page loads that provides information on branching.
h3. Actual Results
The URL "https://www.atlassian.com/git/workflows" loads, but is no longer a valid url resulting a 404 page.
h3. Notes
This should link to [this|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BitbucketServer/Using+branches+in+Bitbucket+Server] page possibly?

h3.Workaround
None.
fields.summary: Broken link for "Learn more about branching strategies" in JIRA issue page

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Pasting a screenshot or other image into the visual tab in IE while editing, creating, or viewing an issue on a Kanban or Scrum board will fail with a javascript error.

h3. Environment
* IE 11
* Kanban/Scrum boards

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to a Kanban board
# Select an issue on the board
# In the Issue view on the right click on the description
# Select the visual tab
# Copy and paste an image into the visual tab

h3. Expected Results
Image is pasted into visual tab, editing can continue and the image is attached when the edit is saved.

h3. Actual Results
Javascript error is thrown and displayed on the page
{noformat}
Exception: Unable to get property 'nodeType' of undefined or null reference
{noformat}
 !Screen Shot 2017-03-23 at 2.44.14 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
* Create is also affected by this while on the board (main create link in menu bar).
* This only occurs in the boards, pasting images works fine in the standard issue or create views.
* Can also happen without pasting an image and just switching tabs.

h3.Workaround
Edit issues in issue view or in search instead of from the board.
fields.summary: IE nodeType script error on image paste while accessing issue from board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h4. Current Situation
When creating a branch in git called e.g. "{{feature/PRJX-123}}" and pushing that to GitHub then the issue is properly displayed in the JIRA development tab.
But if the branch is called with lower case characters e.g. "{{feature/prjx-123}}" this will not be recognized by the JIRA DVCS plugin.

h4. Requested Change
The DVCS plugin shall be configurable that it can accept issues case insensitive, so that it accepts e.g. "{{PRJX-123}}" and "{{prjx-123}}" to be linked to the JIRA issue "{{PRJX-123}}".

h4. Use Case
Due to users working on Windows we've had a lot of problems with git branch names if they differ only in case. Therefore a GitHub pre-receive hook shall allow only lower case branch names, but this is in contradiction to use JIRA issue numbers as branch names.
fields.summary: DVCS connector shall recognize issue IDs case insensitive
